definition: perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]
"water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
Genghis Khan (1162-1227), founder and ruler of the Mongol Empire

sentences.english: After each day I would just put the sweaty clothes into the same bag.
sentences.chinese: 每天偶都把汗滋滋的球衣放到包裏。

sentences.english: AlthoughI walked slowly, I got hot and sweaty.
sentences.chinese: 雖然我走得慢，但是我還是熱出了一身汗。

sentences.english: It's rather hot today. Here's a towel for you to wipe your face.
sentences.chinese: 今天氣象太暖了，給您一條毛巾揩抹汗。

sentences.english: And in spite of its being winter I would perspire all over.
sentences.chinese: 儘管這時還是冬天，我卻渾身都被汗溼透。

sentences.english: The mixture of his sweat and deodorant smells gross.
sentences.chinese: 他的汗和體香劑混合在一起的味道聞起來真噁心。

sentences.english: Temur Khan was the 7th-generation descendant of Genghis Khan.
sentences.chinese: 鐵木爾汗是成吉思汗的第七世孫。

sentences.english: And I was doubled over, soaked through my clothes sweating.
sentences.chinese: 我痛得直不起腰來，衣服全被汗溼透了。

sentences.english: No one ever drowned in sweat.
Last night Aamir Khan called me.
sentences.chinese: 阿米爾汗昨晚打電話給我。

sentences.english: The year 1274 saw Mongol ruler Kublai Khan's first invasion of Japan.
sentences.chinese: 在一二七四年，蒙古統治者忽必烈汗第一次進侵日本。

sentences.english: In the winter, perspiration permeated through all over his clothes.
sentences.chinese: 冬天時，他的汗從內裏透出外衣，汗漬斑斑。

sentences.english: He wiped the sweat from his face.
At Peking was the Great Khan, and they were hospitably entertained.
sentences.chinese: 忽必烈汗在北京，他們受到了盛情款待。

sentences.english: The perspiration was running down my back.
After the sweat coated skin care products, steam, sweat will also be taken away, but not without effect.
sentences.chinese: 塗過護膚品後汗蒸，也會被汗水帶走，反而沒無效果。

definition: to wipe/to erase/rubbing (brush stroke in painting)/to clean/to polish
to smear/to wipe/to erase/classifier for wisps of cloud, light-beams etc
